Subject: Creative Destruction
Description: Explore the act of destruction as a creative influence, drawing sources from economic theory, philosophy, theology, cosmology, ecology and technology.  Is the nature of creativity in reality a destructive force? Progress is not necessarily a linear, geometric progression but rather destructive stimulus often precede creativity and explosive growth.    Speakers include:Mark Haynes (m), Jennifer Hamilton, Ramses Alcaide - Track: Science  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none
